ACCEL.description: ACCEL: (FREE42, smartphone accelerometer) Query the accelerometer. The three components of the acceleration vector are returned in the X, Y, and Z registers. Holding the device facing you, in portrait orientation, and the dock connector pointing towards the floor, positive X is acceleration toward the left, positive Y is acceleration downwards, and positive Z is acceleration away from you -- or, in terms of gravity, positive X is gravity pulling to the right, positive Y is gravity pulling upwards, and positive Z is gravity pulling toward you. Note: Accelerations are returned in units of Earth gravities, not m/s2 as you might expect. The iPhone API documentation does not mention the specific conversion factor used by the device.

ACOS.description: ACOS: Arc cosine. Returns cos–1 x.

ACOSH.description: ACOSH: Arc hyperbolic cosine. Returns cosh–1 x.

ADATE.description: ADATE: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Appends the contents of the X register to the ALPHA register, formatted as a date value: in DMY mode, DD.MMYYYY is displayed as DD.MM.YYYY, and in MDY mode, MM.DDYYYY is displayed as MM/DD/YYYY. If the number of digits of the display mode is 4 or less, the century part is omitted; if it is 2 or less, the entire year part is omitted; and if it is 0, the months or days part is omitted (in DMY or MDY mode, respectively).

AGRAPH.description: AGRAPH: Alpha graphics. Display a graphics image. Each character in the alpha register specifies an 8-dot column pattern. The x- and y-registers specify the pixel location of the image.

AIP.description: AIP: Append Integer part of x to the alpha register.

ALENG.description: ALENG: Alpha length. Returns the number of characters in the alpha register.

ALL.description: ALL: Select ALLΣ (All-statistics) mode, which uses 13 summation coefficients.

ALLΣ.description: ALLΣ: Select ALLΣ (All-statistics) mode, which uses 13 summation coefficients.

AND.description: AND: Logical AND. Returns x AND y.

ANUM.description: ANUM: Scans the ALPHA register for a number, and places it into the X register. If a number is found, the numeric input flag, flag 22, is set.

AOFF.description: AOFF: Alpha off. Exit from the ALPHA menu.

AON.description: AON: Alpha on. Select the ALPHA menu.

ARCL <number>.description: ARCL <number>: Alpha recall. Copy data into the alpha register, appending it to the current contents. Numbers are formatted using the current display format. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ARCL IND <number>.description: ARCL IND <number>: Alpha recall. Copy data into the alpha register, appending it to the current contents. Numbers are formatted using the current display format. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ARCL ST <stack>.description: ARCL ST <stack>: Alpha recall. Copy data into the alpha register, appending it to the current contents. Numbers are formatted using the current display format. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ARCL IND ST <stack>.description: ARCL IND ST <stack>: Alpha recall. Copy data into the alpha register, appending it to the current contents. Numbers are formatted using the current display format. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ARCL \"<name>\".description: ARCL "<name>": Alpha recall. Copy data into the alpha register, appending it to the current contents. Numbers are formatted using the current display format. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ARCL IND \"<name>\".description: ARCL IND "<name>": Alpha recall. Copy data into the alpha register, appending it to the current contents. Numbers are formatted using the current display format. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

AROT.description: AROT: Alpha rotate. Rotate the alpha register by the number of characters specified in the x-register.

ASHF.description: ASHF: Alpha shift. Shifts the six left-most characters out of the alpha register.

ASIN.description: ASIN: Arc sine. Returns sin–1 x.

ASINH.description: ASINH: Arc hyperbolic sine. Returns sinh–1 x.

ASSIGN \"<name>\" TO <number>.description: ASSIGN "<name>" TO <number>: Assign a function, program, or variable to a menu key in the custom menu. Parameter 1: function name, alpha program label, or variable name. Parameter 2: key number (01–18).

ASTO <number>.description: ASTO <number>: Alpha store. Copy the first six characters in the alpha register into a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ASTO IND <number>.description: ASTO IND <number>: Alpha store. Copy the first six characters in the alpha register into a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ASTO ST <stack>.description: ASTO ST <stack>: Alpha store. Copy the first six characters in the alpha register into a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ASTO IND ST <stack>.description: ASTO IND ST <stack>: Alpha store. Copy the first six characters in the alpha register into a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ASTO \"<name>\".description: ASTO "<name>": Alpha store. Copy the first six characters in the alpha register into a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ASTO IND \"<name>\".description: ASTO IND "<name>": Alpha store. Copy the first six characters in the alpha register into a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ATAN.description: ATAN: Arc tangent. Returns tan–1 x.

ATANH.description: ATANH: Arc hyperbolic tangent. Returns tanh–1 x.

ATIME.description: ATIME: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Appends the contents of the X register to the ALPHA register, formatted as a time value: HH.MMSSss is displayed as HH:MM:SS.ss. In CLK12 mode, times with HH between -23 and 23 are displayed in 12-hour format: -23 to -13 as -HH-12 PM; -12 to -1 as -HH PM; 0 as 12 AM; 1 to 11 as HH AM; 12 as 12 PM; 13 to 23 as HH-12 PM. When |HH| ≥ 24, the sign is ignored, and HH is shown as is, with no AM or PM appended. In CLK24 mode, HH between -1 and -11 are displayed as -HH+12; all other values are shown as |HH|. No AM or PM are displayed. If the number of digits of the display mode is 4 or less, the centiseconds part is omitted; if it is 2 or less, the seconds part is omitted; and if it is 0, the minutes part is omitted.

ATIME24.description: ATIME24: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Like ATIME (see above), except it always formats the time in 24-hour format, regardless of the CLK12/CLK24 setting.

ATOX.description: ATOX: Alpha to X. Convert the left-most character in the alpha register to its character code (returned to the x-register) and delete the character.

AVIEW.description: AVIEW: Alpha view. Display the alpha register.

BASE+.description: BASE+: Base addition. Returns the 36-bit sum of y + x.

BASE-.description: BASE-: Base subtraction. Returns the 36-bit difference of y – x.

BASE×.description: BASE×: Base multiplication. Returns the 36-bit product of y x x.

BASE÷.description: BASE÷: Base division. Returns the 36-bit quotient of y ÷ x.

BASE±.description: BASE±: Base change sign. Returns the 36-bit 2's complement of x.

BEEP.description: BEEP: Sound a sequence of four tones.

BEST.description: BEST: Select the best curve-fitting model for the current statistical data.

BIT?.description: BIT?: Test the xth bit of y. If the bit is set (1), execute the next program line; if the bit is clear (0), skip the next program line.

BSIGNED.description: BSIGNED: Toggles signed mode. In signed mode, numbers are interpreted as two's complement signed integers, like on the real HP-42S and in earlier versions of Free42; in unsigned mode, numbers are always interpreted as non-negative, and negative numbers do not exist. You can check whether signed or unsigned mode is active by checking the MODES menu, where there will be a dot marking the BSGN menu item when signed mode is active. Alternatively, you can check flag 78.

BWRAP.description: BWRAP: Toggles wrapped mode. In wrapped mode, numbers are kept within WSIZE bits by discarding any bits to the left of bit WSIZE−1; in non-wrapped mode, numbers outside of the binary range are not allowed and cause Invalid Data errors when parameters are out of range, or Out of Range errors when results are out of range. You can check whether wrapped or non-wrapped mode is active by checking the MODES menu, where there will be a dot marking the BWRP menu item when wrapped mode is active. Alternatively, you can check flag 79.

BRESET.description: BRESET: Resets all BASE modes back to their defaults, which match the behavior of the real HP-42S: WSIZE 36, signed, not wrapped.

CF <number>.description: CF <number>: Clear flag nn (00 ≤  nn ≤ 35 or 81 ≤  nn ≤ 99). Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

CF IND <number>.description: CF IND <number>: Clear flag nn (00 ≤  nn ≤ 35 or 81 ≤  nn ≤ 99). Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

CF IND ST <stack>.description: CF IND ST <stack>: Clear flag nn (00 ≤  nn ≤ 35 or 81 ≤  nn ≤ 99). Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

CF IND \"<name>\".description: CF IND "<name>": Clear flag nn (00 ≤  nn ≤ 35 or 81 ≤  nn ≤ 99). Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

CLA.description: CLA: Clear alpha register. If alpha mode is on and character entry is terminated (no cursor displayed), then  ◄  also executes the CLA function.

CLD.description: CLD: Clear display. Clear a message from the display.

CLK12.description: CLK12: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Display the time in 12-hour format with AM/PM.

CLK24.description: CLK24: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Display the time in 24-hour format.

CLKEYS.description: CLKEYS: Clear all custom menu key assignments.

CLLCD.description: CLLCD: Clear LCD (liquid crystal display). Blanks the entire display.

CLMENU.description: CLMENU: Clear MENU. Deletes all menu key definitions for the programmable menu.

CLP \"<name>\".description: CLP "<name>": Clear a program from memory. Parameter: global label.

CLRG.description: CLRG: Clear Registers. Clear all of the numbered storage registers to zero.

CLST.description: CLST: Clear Stack. Clear the stack registers to zero.

CLV IND <number>.description: CLV IND <number>: Clear a variable from memory. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

CLV IND ST <stack>.description: CLV IND ST <stack>: Clear a variable from memory. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

CLV \"<name>\".description: CLV "<name>": Clear a variable from memory. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

CLV IND \"<name>\".description: CLV IND "<name>": Clear a variable from memory. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

CLX.description: CLX: Clear x-register to zero. If digit entry is terminated (no cursor in the display), then  ◄  also executes CLX.

CLΣ.description: CLΣ: Clear statistics. Clear the accumulated statistical data in the summation registers.

COMB.description: COMB: Combinations of y items taken x at a time = y! / [x!(y-x)!].

COMPLEX.description: COMPLEX: Convert two real numbers (or matrices) into a complex number (or matrix). Converts a complex number (or matrix) into two real numbers (or matrices).

CORR.description: CORR: Returns a correlation coefficient using the current statistical data and curve-fitting model.

CPXRES.description: CPXRES: Complex-results. Enable the calculator to return a complex result, even if the inputs are real numbers.

CPX?.description: CPX?: If the x-register contains a complex number, execute the next program line; if the x-register does not contain a complex number, skip the next program line.

CROSS.description: CROSS: Returns the cross product of two vectors (matrices or complex numbers).

DATE.description: DATE: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Returns the current date to the X register. In MDY mode, the date is returned as MM.DDYYYY, and in DMY mode, it is returned as DD.MMYYYY. In addition, when executed from the keyboard, this also displays the date formatted as "MM/DD/YYYY DOW" or "DD.MM.YYYY DOW", respectively.

DATE+.description: DATE+: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Takes a date from the Y register, and adds a number of days from the X register.

DDAYS.description: DDAYS: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Calculates the number of days between the date in the Y register and the date in the X register. If the date in the Y register is earlier, then the result will be positive.

DEG.description: DEG: Select the Degrees angular mode.

DELAY.description: DELAY: Set the print delay time to x seconds.

DELR.description: DELR: Delete row. Delete the current row from the indexed matrix.

DET.description: DET: Determinant. Returns the determinant of the matrix in the x-register.

DIM IND <number>.description: DIM IND <number>: Dimension a matrix to x columns and y rows. If the matrix does not exist, DIM creates it. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

DIM IND ST <stack>.description: DIM IND ST <stack>: Dimension a matrix to x columns and y rows. If the matrix does not exist, DIM creates it. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

DIM \"<name>\".description: DIM "<name>": Dimension a matrix to x columns and y rows. If the matrix does not exist, DIM creates it. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

DIM IND \"<name>\".description: DIM IND "<name>": Dimension a matrix to x columns and y rows. If the matrix does not exist, DIM creates it. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

DIM?.description: DIM?: Returns the dimensions of the matrix in the x-register (rows to the y-register and columns to the x-register).

DMY.description: DMY: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Display, return, and accept dates in day/month/year format.

DOT.description: DOT: Dot Product.  Returns the dot product of two vectors (matrices or complex numbers).

DOW.description: DOW: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Calculates the day of the week for the date in the X register. Returns a number from 0 to 6, where 0 is Sunday, 1 is Monday, and so on. When this function is executed from the keyboard, the day is also displayed in a human-friendly format, i.e. MON for Monday, TUE for Tuesday, etc.

DSE <number>.description: DSE <number>: Decrement, skip if (less than or) equal. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, decrements ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now ≤  fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

DSE IND <number>.description: DSE IND <number>: Decrement, skip if (less than or) equal. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, decrements ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now ≤  fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

DSE ST <stack>.description: DSE ST <stack>: Decrement, skip if (less than or) equal. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, decrements ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now ≤  fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

DSE IND ST <stack>.description: DSE IND ST <stack>: Decrement, skip if (less than or) equal. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, decrements ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now ≤  fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

DSE \"<name>\".description: DSE "<name>": Decrement, skip if (less than or) equal. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, decrements ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now ≤  fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

DSE IND \"<name>\".description: DSE IND "<name>": Decrement, skip if (less than or) equal. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, decrements ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now ≤  fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

EDIT.description: EDIT: Edit a matrix in the x-register.

EDITN IND <number>.description: EDITN IND <number>: Edit a named matrix. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

EDITN IND ST <stack>.description: EDITN IND ST <stack>: Edit a named matrix. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

EDITN \"<name>\".description: EDITN "<name>": Edit a named matrix. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

EDITN IND \"<name>\".description: EDITN IND "<name>": Edit a named matrix. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

.END..description: .END.: End of a program. Use `.END.` for standard program end.

ENG <number>.description: ENG <number>: Select engineering display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

ENG IND <number>.description: ENG IND <number>: Select engineering display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

ENG IND ST <stack>.description: ENG IND ST <stack>: Select engineering display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

ENG IND \"<name>\".description: ENG IND "<name>": Select engineering display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

ENTER.description: ENTER: Separate two numbers keyed in sequentially; copies x into the y-register, y into the z-register, and z into the t-register, and loses t.

EXPF.description: EXPF: Select the exponential curve-fitting model.

E↑X-1.description: E↑X-1: Natural exponential for values of x which are close to zero. Returns ex–1, which provides a much higher accuracy in the fractional part of the result.

FC? <number>.description: FC? <number>: Flag clear test. If the specified flag is clear, executes the next program line; if the flag is set, skips the next program line. Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FC? IND <number>.description: FC? IND <number>: Flag clear test. If the specified flag is clear, executes the next program line; if the flag is set, skips the next program line. Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FC? IND ST <stack>.description: FC? IND ST <stack>: Flag clear test. If the specified flag is clear, executes the next program line; if the flag is set, skips the next program line. Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FC? IND \"<name>\".description: FC? IND "<name>": Flag clear test. If the specified flag is clear, executes the next program line; if the flag is set, skips the next program line. Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FC?C <number>.description: FC?C <number>: Flag clear test and clear. If the specified flag is clear, execute the next program line; if the flag is set, skip the next program line. Cleared after the test is complete. (This function can be used only with flags 00 through 35 and 81 through 99.) Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FC?C IND <number>.description: FC?C IND <number>: Flag clear test and clear. If the specified flag is clear, execute the next program line; if the flag is set, skip the next program line. Cleared after the test is complete. (This function can be used only with flags 00 through 35 and 81 through 99.) Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FC?C IND ST <stack>.description: FC?C IND ST <stack>: Flag clear test and clear. If the specified flag is clear, execute the next program line; if the flag is set, skip the next program line. Cleared after the test is complete. (This function can be used only with flags 00 through 35 and 81 through 99.) Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FC?C IND \"<name>\".description: FC?C IND "<name>": Flag clear test and clear. If the specified flag is clear, execute the next program line; if the flag is set, skip the next program line. Cleared after the test is complete. (This function can be used only with flags 00 through 35 and 81 through 99.) Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FCSTX.description: FCSTX: Forecasts an x-value given a y-value.

FCSTY.description: FCSTY: Forecasts a y-value given an x-value.

FIX <number>.description: FIX <number>: Select fixed-decimal display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

FIX IND <number>.description: FIX IND <number>: Select fixed-decimal display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

FIX IND ST <stack>.description: FIX IND ST <stack>: Select fixed-decimal display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

FIX IND \"<name>\".description: FIX IND "<name>": Select fixed-decimal display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

FNRM.description: FNRM: Returns the Frobenius norm of the matrix in the x-register.

FP.description: FP: Returns the fractional part of x.

FS? <number>.description: FS? <number>: Flag set test. If the specified flag is set, execute the next program line; if the flag is clear, skip the next program line. Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FS? IND <number>.description: FS? IND <number>: Flag set test. If the specified flag is set, execute the next program line; if the flag is clear, skip the next program line. Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FS? IND ST <stack>.description: FS? IND ST <stack>: Flag set test. If the specified flag is set, execute the next program line; if the flag is clear, skip the next program line. Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FS? IND \"<name>\".description: FS? IND "<name>": Flag set test. If the specified flag is set, execute the next program line; if the flag is clear, skip the next program line. Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FS?C <number>.description: FS?C <number>: Flag set test and clear. If the specified flag is set, execute the next program line; if the flag is clear, skip the next program line. Clear the flag after the test is complete. (This function can be used only with flags 00 through 35 and 81 through 99.) Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FS?C IND <number>.description: FS?C IND <number>: Flag set test and clear. If the specified flag is set, execute the next program line; if the flag is clear, skip the next program line. Clear the flag after the test is complete. (This function can be used only with flags 00 through 35 and 81 through 99.) Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FS?C IND ST <stack>.description: FS?C IND ST <stack>: Flag set test and clear. If the specified flag is set, execute the next program line; if the flag is clear, skip the next program line. Clear the flag after the test is complete. (This function can be used only with flags 00 through 35 and 81 through 99.) Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FS?C IND \"<name>\".description: FS?C IND "<name>": Flag set test and clear. If the specified flag is set, execute the next program line; if the flag is clear, skip the next program line. Clear the flag after the test is complete. (This function can be used only with flags 00 through 35 and 81 through 99.) Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

FUNC <number>.description: FUNC <number>: Prepare user-defined function. Save the contents of the stack and LASTx; when the function returns, this saved data will be used to restore the stack such that it looks as if a built-in function has executed. FUNC takes a two-digit numeric parameter. Each digit can be from 0 to 4. The first digit indicates the number of parameters consumed by the user-defined function, and the second digit indicates the number of values returned.

GETKEY.description: GETKEY: Get key. The calculator waits for you to press a key. When you do, the key number is returned to the x-register. Keys are numbered from 1 through 37 ( Σ+  through  ÷ )for normal keys and 38 through 74 (■ Σ–   through ■CATALOG) for shifted keys.

GETKEY1.description: GETKEY1: This function works like the regular GETKEY, except it does not halt program execution when EXIT or Shift-EXIT are pressed, allowing programs to implement custom behaviors for those keys. GETKEY1 does halt on R/S, like GETKEY.

GETM.description: GETM: Get matrix. Copy a submatrix into the x-register from the indexed matrix.

GROW.description: GROW: Select grow mode. Executing → or J+ causes the matrix to grow by one new row if the index pointers are at the last (lower-right) element in the matrix.

GTO <number>.description: GTO <number>: Go to label. From the keyboard, move the program pointer to the specified label. In a running program, cause the program to branch to the specified label. Parameter: local or global label (indirect allowed).

GTO IND <number>.description: GTO IND <number>: Go to label. From the keyboard, move the program pointer to the specified label. In a running program, cause the program to branch to the specified label. Parameter: local or global label (indirect allowed).

GTO IND ST <stack>.description: GTO IND ST <stack>: Go to label. From the keyboard, move the program pointer to the specified label. In a running program, cause the program to branch to the specified label. Parameter: local or global label (indirect allowed).

GTO <alpha_local_label>.description: GTO <alpha_local_label>: Go to label. From the keyboard, move the program pointer to the specified label. In a running program, cause the program to branch to the specified label. Parameter: local or global label (indirect allowed).

GTO \"<name>\".description: GTO "<name>": Go to label. From the keyboard, move the program pointer to the specified label. In a running program, cause the program to branch to the specified label. Parameter: local or global label (indirect allowed).

GTO IND \"<name>\".description: GTO IND "<name>": Go to label. From the keyboard, move the program pointer to the specified label. In a running program, cause the program to branch to the specified label. Parameter: local or global label (indirect allowed).

HEADING.description: HEADING: (FREE42, smartphone compass support) Query the compass. This only works on the iPhone 3GS; other devices return Nonexistent. It returns the following data: magnetic heading in X, true heading in Y, heading accuracy in Z, and the raw magnetic vector in a three-element vector in T. The headings and accuracy are given in degrees, where North is 0, East is 90, and so on; the components of the magnetic vector are given in microteslas. The components are oriented with respect to the device along the same axes as the accelerometer readouts.

HMS+.description: HMS+: Add x and y using H.MMSSss (hours-minutes-seconds) format.

HMS-.description: HMS-: Subtract x from y using H.MMSSss (hours-minutes-seconds) format.

I+.description: I+: Increment the row pointer in the indexed matrix.

I-.description: I-: Decrement the row pointer in the indexed matrix.

INDEX IND <number>.description: INDEX IND <number>: Index a named matrix. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

INDEX IND ST <stack>.description: INDEX IND ST <stack>: Index a named matrix. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

INDEX \"<name>\".description: INDEX "<name>": Index a named matrix. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

INDEX IND \"<name>\".description: INDEX IND "<name>": Index a named matrix. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

INPUT <number>.description: INPUT <number>: Recall a register or variable to the x-register, display the name of the register or variable along with the contents of the x-register, and halt program execution. Pressing R/S (or ■SST) stores x into the register or variable; pressing EXIT cancels. (Used only in programs.) Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

INPUT IND <number>.description: INPUT IND <number>: Recall a register or variable to the x-register, display the name of the register or variable along with the contents of the x-register, and halt program execution. Pressing R/S (or ■SST) stores x into the register or variable; pressing EXIT cancels. (Used only in programs.) Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

INPUT ST <stack>.description: INPUT ST <stack>: Recall a register or variable to the x-register, display the name of the register or variable along with the contents of the x-register, and halt program execution. Pressing R/S (or ■SST) stores x into the register or variable; pressing EXIT cancels. (Used only in programs.) Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

INPUT IND ST <stack>.description: INPUT IND ST <stack>: Recall a register or variable to the x-register, display the name of the register or variable along with the contents of the x-register, and halt program execution. Pressing R/S (or ■SST) stores x into the register or variable; pressing EXIT cancels. (Used only in programs.) Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

INPUT \"<name>\".description: INPUT "<name>": Recall a register or variable to the x-register, display the name of the register or variable along with the contents of the x-register, and halt program execution. Pressing R/S (or ■SST) stores x into the register or variable; pressing EXIT cancels. (Used only in programs.) Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

INPUT IND \"<name>\".description: INPUT IND "<name>": Recall a register or variable to the x-register, display the name of the register or variable along with the contents of the x-register, and halt program execution. Pressing R/S (or ■SST) stores x into the register or variable; pressing EXIT cancels. (Used only in programs.) Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

INSR.description: INSR: Insert a row in the indexed matrix.

INTEG IND <number>.description: INTEG IND <number>: Integrate the selected integration program with respect to the specified variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

INTEG IND ST <stack>.description: INTEG IND ST <stack>: Integrate the selected integration program with respect to the specified variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

INTEG \"<name>\".description: INTEG "<name>": Integrate the selected integration program with respect to the specified variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

INTEG IND \"<name>\".description: INTEG IND "<name>": Integrate the selected integration program with respect to the specified variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

INVRT.description: INVRT: Returns the inverse of the matrix in the x-register.

IP.description: IP: Returns the integer part of x.

ISG <number>.description: ISG <number>: Increment, skip if greater. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, increments ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now > fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ISG IND <number>.description: ISG IND <number>: Increment, skip if greater. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, increments ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now > fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ISG ST <stack>.description: ISG ST <stack>: Increment, skip if greater. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, increments ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now > fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ISG IND ST <stack>.description: ISG IND ST <stack>: Increment, skip if greater. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, increments ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now > fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ISG \"<name>\".description: ISG "<name>": Increment, skip if greater. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, increments ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now > fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

ISG IND \"<name>\".description: ISG IND "<name>": Increment, skip if greater. Given ccccccc.fffii in a variable or register, increments ccccccc by ii and skips the next program line if ccccccc is now > fff. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

J+.description: J+: Increment the column pointer in the indexed matrix.

J-.description: J-: Decrement the column pointer in the indexed matrix.

KEYASN.description: KEYASN: Selects key-assignments mode for the custom menu.

KEY <number> GTO <number>.description: KEY <number> GTO <number>: On menu key, go to. Branch to specified label to when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> GTO IND <number>.description: KEY <number> GTO IND <number>: On menu key, go to. Branch to specified label to when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> GTO IND ST <stack>.description: KEY <number> GTO IND ST <stack>: On menu key, go to. Branch to specified label to when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> GTO <alpha_local_label>.description: KEY <number> GTO <alpha_local_label>: On menu key, go to. Branch to specified label to when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> GTO \"<name>\".description: KEY <number> GTO "<name>": On menu key, go to. Branch to specified label to when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> GTO IND \"<name>\".description: KEY <number> GTO IND "<name>": On menu key, go to. Branch to specified label to when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> XEQ <number>.description: KEY <number> XEQ <number>: On menu key, execute. Execute (as a subroutine) specified label when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> XEQ IND <number>.description: KEY <number> XEQ IND <number>: On menu key, execute. Execute (as a subroutine) specified label when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> XEQ IND ST <stack>.description: KEY <number> XEQ IND ST <stack>: On menu key, execute. Execute (as a subroutine) specified label when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> XEQ <alpha_local_label>.description: KEY <number> XEQ <alpha_local_label>: On menu key, execute. Execute (as a subroutine) specified label when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> XEQ \"<name>\".description: KEY <number> XEQ "<name>": On menu key, execute. Execute (as a subroutine) specified label when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

KEY <number> XEQ IND \"<name>\".description: KEY <number> XEQ IND "<name>": On menu key, execute. Execute (as a subroutine) specified label when a particular menu key is pressed. Parameter 1: Key number (1 through 9), Parameter 2: program label (global or local).

LASTX.description: LASTX: Last x. Recall the last value of x used in a calculation.

LBL \"<name>\".description: LBL "<name>": Label. Identify programs and routines for execution and branching. Parameter: local or global label.

LBL <number>.description: LBL <number>: Label. Identify programs and routines for execution and branching. Parameter: local or global label.

LBL <alpha_local_label>.description: LBL <alpha_local_label>: Label. Identify programs and routines for execution and branching. Parameter: local or global label.

LCLBL.description: LCLBL: Select local label mode for the custom menu (to use custom menu assignments to execute local labels within the current program).

LINF.description: LINF: Select the linear curve-fitting model.

LINΣ.description: LINΣ: Select linear statistics mode, which uses six summation coefficients.

LN1+X.description: LN1+X: Natural logarithm for values close to zero. Returns ln(1 + x), which provides a much higher accuracy in the fractional part of the result.

LOCAT.description: LOCAT: (FREE42, smartphone location services) Query Location Services*. The location is returned as follows: latitude in X, longitude in Y, elevation in Z, and horizontal and vertical accuracy in a two-element vector in T. The latitude and longitude are given in decimal degrees, with North and East being positive; the elevation and accuracies are given in meters. If an accuracy is -1, that means that the corresponding measurement is not valid. * The iPod touch uses Skyhook (a proprietary WiFi-MAC-to-location mapping service) to determine its position; the first generation iPhone uses Skyhook and cellular triangulation, and the iPhone 3G and 3GS have a built-in GPS receiver. All of these means of determining the device's location are exposed through the unified Location Services API.

LOGF.description: LOGF: Select the logarithmic curve-fitting model.

LSTO \"<name>\".description: LSTO "<name>": Used to create local variables. These are variables that exist only for the duration of the current subroutine, and are automatically deleted when it returns.

LSTO IND <number>.description: LSTO IND <number>: Store a copy of x into a local variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

LSTO IND ST <stack>.description: LSTO IND ST <stack>: Store a copy of x into a local variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

LSTO IND \"<name>\".description: LSTO IND "<name>": Store a copy of x into a local variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

MAT?.description: MAT?: If the x-register contains a matrix, execute the next program line; if the X-register does not contain a matrix, skip the next program line.

MEAN.description: MEAN: Mean. Returns the mean of x-values (Σx / n) and the mean of y-values (Σy / n).

MDY.description: MDY: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Display, return, and accept dates in month/day/year format.

MOD.description: MOD: Modulo. Returns the remainder for y / x.

MVAR \"<name>\".description: MVAR "<name>": Declare a menu variable in a SOLVER program. Parameter: variable name.

MVARCAT.description: MVARCAT: Returns a matrix in X-register with all the functions with MVAR.

NEWMAT.description: NEWMAT: New matrix. Creates a y × x matrix in the x-register.

NOP.description: NOP: No Operation. Can be used as a filler when ISG is used in a way where it will always skip the next instruction, like when using it as a counter with no upper limit. In raw files, this instruction is encoded as 0xF0, which corresponds to TEXT 0 in the HP-41, which is sometimes used as a synthetic NOP on that platform.

NORM.description: NORM: Select normal print mode, which prints a record of keystrokes.

OFF.description: OFF: Turn the calculator off (programmable). Pressing ■OFF does not execute the programmable OFF function.

OLD.description: OLD: Recall the current element from the indexed matrix. (Equivalent to RCLEL.)

ON.description: ON: Continuous on. Prevent the calculator from automatically turning off after ten minutes of inactivity.

OR.description: OR: Logical OR. Returns x OR y.

PERM.description: PERM: Permutations of y items taken x at a time. Returns y!/(y – x)!

PGMINT IND ST <stack>.description: PGMINT IND ST <stack>: Select a program to integrate. Parameter: global label (indirect allowed).

PGMINT \"<name>\".description: PGMINT "<name>": Select a program to integrate. Parameter: global label (indirect allowed).

PGMINT IND \"<name>\".description: PGMINT IND "<name>": Select a program to integrate. Parameter: global label (indirect allowed).

PGMSLV IND <number>.description: PGMSLV IND <number>: Select a program to solve. Parameter: global label (indirect allowed).

PGMSLV IND ST <stack>.description: PGMSLV IND ST <stack>: Select a program to solve. Parameter: global label (indirect allowed).

PGMSLV \"<name>\".description: PGMSLV "<name>": Select a program to solve. Parameter: global label (indirect allowed).

PGMSLV IND \"<name>\".description: PGMSLV IND "<name>": Select a program to solve. Parameter: global label (indirect allowed).

PI.description: PI: Put an approximation of π into the x-register (3.14159265359).

PIXEL.description: PIXEL: Turn on a single pixel (dot) in the display. The location of the pixel is given by the numbers in the x- and y-registers.

POLAR.description: POLAR: Select polar coordinate mode for displaying complex numbers.

POSA.description: POSA: Position in alpha. Searches the alpha register for the target specified in the x-register. If found, returns the character position; if not found, returns -1.

PRLCD.description: PRLCD: Print LCD (liquid crystal display). Prints the entire display.

PROFF.description: PROFF: Printing off. Clears flags 21 and 55.

PROMPT.description: PROMPT: Display the alpha register and halt program execution.

PRON.description: PRON: Printing on. Sets flags 21 and 55.

PRSTK.description: PRSTK: Print stack. Print the contents of the stack registers (x, y, z and t).

PRUSR.description: PRUSR: Print user variables and programs.

PRV IND <number>.description: PRV IND <number>: Print variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

PRV IND ST <stack>.description: PRV IND ST <stack>: Print variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

PRV \"<name>\".description: PRV "<name>": Print variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

PRV IND \"<name>\".description: PRV IND "<name>": Print variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

PRΣ.description: PRΣ: Print statistics. Prints the contents of the summation registers.

PSE.description: PSE: Pause program execution for about 1 second.

PUTM.description: PUTM: Put matrix. Stores the matrix in the X-register into the indexed matrix beginning at the current element.

PWRF.description: PWRF: Select the power curve-fitting model.

RAN.description: RAN: Returns a random number (0 ≤ x < 1)

RCL <number>.description: RCL <number>: Recall data into the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL IND <number>.description: RCL IND <number>: Recall data into the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL ST <stack>.description: RCL ST <stack>: Recall data into the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL IND ST <stack>.description: RCL IND ST <stack>: Recall data into the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL \"<name>\".description: RCL "<name>": Recall data into the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL IND \"<name>\".description: RCL IND "<name>": Recall data into the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL+ <number>.description: RCL+ <number>: Recall addition. Recall data and add it to the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL+ IND <number>.description: RCL+ IND <number>: Recall addition. Recall data and add it to the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL+ ST <stack>.description: RCL+ ST <stack>: Recall addition. Recall data and add it to the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL+ IND ST <stack>.description: RCL+ IND ST <stack>: Recall addition. Recall data and add it to the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL+ \"<name>\".description: RCL+ "<name>": Recall addition. Recall data and add it to the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL+ IND \"<name>\".description: RCL+ IND "<name>": Recall addition. Recall data and add it to the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL- <number>.description: RCL- <number>: Recall subtraction. Recall data and subtract it from the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL- IND <number>.description: RCL- IND <number>: Recall subtraction. Recall data and subtract it from the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL- ST <stack>.description: RCL- ST <stack>: Recall subtraction. Recall data and subtract it from the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL- IND ST <stack>.description: RCL- IND ST <stack>: Recall subtraction. Recall data and subtract it from the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL- \"<name>\".description: RCL- "<name>": Recall subtraction. Recall data and subtract it from the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL- IND \"<name>\".description: RCL- IND "<name>": Recall subtraction. Recall data and subtract it from the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL× <number>.description: RCL× <number>: Recall multiplication. Recall data and multiply it by the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL× IND <number>.description: RCL× IND <number>: Recall multiplication. Recall data and multiply it by the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL× ST <stack>.description: RCL× ST <stack>: Recall multiplication. Recall data and multiply it by the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL× IND ST <stack>.description: RCL× IND ST <stack>: Recall multiplication. Recall data and multiply it by the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL× \"<name>\".description: RCL× "<name>": Recall multiplication. Recall data and multiply it by the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL× IND \"<name>\".description: RCL× IND "<name>": Recall multiplication. Recall data and multiply it by the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL÷ <number>.description: RCL÷ <number>: Recall division. Recall data and divide it into the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL÷ IND <number>.description: RCL÷ IND <number>: Recall division. Recall data and divide it into the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL÷ ST <stack>.description: RCL÷ ST <stack>: Recall division. Recall data and divide it into the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL÷ IND ST <stack>.description: RCL÷ IND ST <stack>: Recall division. Recall data and divide it into the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL÷ \"<name>\".description: RCL÷ "<name>": Recall division. Recall data and divide it into the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCL÷ IND \"<name>\".description: RCL÷ IND "<name>": Recall division. Recall data and divide it into the contents of the x-register. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

RCLEL.description: RCLEL: Recall element. Recalls the current matrix element from the indexed matrix.

RCLFLAG.description: RCLFLAG: Gets the state of all flags and returns them as a complex number.

RCLIJ.description: RCLIJ: Recall the row- and column-pointer values (I and J) for the indexed matrix.

RDX,.description: RDX,: Select a comma to be used as the radix mark (decimal point).

RDX..description: RDX.: Select a period to be used as the radix mark (decimal point).

REALRES.description: REALRES: Real-results. Disables the calculator's ability to return a complex result using real-number inputs.

REAL?.description: REAL?: If the x-register contains a real number, execute the next program line; if the x-register does not contain a real number, skip the next program line.

RECT.description: RECT: Select rectangular coordinate mode for displaying complex numbers.

RND.description: RND: Round the number in the x-register using the current display format.

RNRM.description: RNRM: Return the row norm of the matrix in the x-register.

ROTXY.description: ROTXY: Rotate the 36-bit number in the y-register by x bits.

RSUM.description: RSUM: Return the row sum of each row of the matrix in the x-register and returns the sums in a column matrix.

RTN.description: RTN: Return. In a running program, branches the program pointer back to the line following the most recent XEQ instruction. If there is no matching XEQ instruction, program execution halts. From the keyboard, RTN moves the program pointer to line 00 of the current program.

RTNERR.description: RTNERR : RTNERR <number>: Return an error and Execution is halted on the XEQ.  0: No Error  1: Alpha Data Is Invalid  2: Out of Range 3: Divide by 0  4: Invalid Type 5: Invalid Data   6: Nonexistent    7: Dimension Error

RTNNO.description: RTNNO: Return from conditional function. To be used by functions that act as conditionals. RTNNO causes the line after the calling XEQ to be skipped, or, if the function was called from the keyboard, it will display the message No, like a built-in conditional.

RTNYES.description: RTNYES: Return from conditional function. To be used by functions that act as conditionals. RTNYES is like RTN, except if the function was called from the keyboard, it will display the message Yes, like a built-in conditional.

R<>R.description: R<>R: Row swap row. Swaps the elements in rows x and y in the indexed matrix.

R↑.description: R↑: Roll up the contents of the four stack registers one position.

R↓.description: R↓: Roll down the contents of the four stack registers one position.

SCI <number>.description: SCI <number>: Select scientific notation display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

SCI IND <number>.description: SCI IND <number>: Select scientific notation display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

SCI IND ST <stack>.description: SCI IND ST <stack>: Select scientific notation display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

SCI IND \"<name>\".description: SCI IND "<name>": Select scientific notation display format. Parameter: number of digits (indirect allowed).

SDEV.description: SDEV: Standard deviation. Returns sx and sy using the current statistical data.

SEED.description: SEED: Store a seed for the random number generator.

SF <number>.description: SF <number>: Set flag nn (00 ≤ nn ≤ 35; 81 ≤ nn ≤ 99). Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

SF IND <number>.description: SF IND <number>: Set flag nn (00 ≤ nn ≤ 35; 81 ≤ nn ≤ 99). Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

SF IND ST <stack>.description: SF IND ST <stack>: Set flag nn (00 ≤ nn ≤ 35; 81 ≤ nn ≤ 99). Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

SF IND \"<name>\".description: SF IND "<name>": Set flag nn (00 ≤ nn ≤ 35; 81 ≤ nn ≤ 99). Parameter: flag number (indirect allowed).

SIGN.description: SIGN: Sign. Return 1 for x ≥ 0, –1 for x < 0, and 0 for non-numbers. Returns the unit vector of a complex number.

SIZE <number>.description: SIZE <number>: Set the number of storage registers. Parameter: number of registers.

SLOPE.description: SLOPE: Return the slope of the linear transformation of the current curve-fitting model.

SOLVE IND <number>.description: SOLVE IND <number>: Solve for an unknown variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

SOLVE IND ST <stack>.description: SOLVE IND ST <stack>: Solve for an unknown variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

SOLVE \"<name>\".description: SOLVE "<name>": Solve for an unknown variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

SOLVE IND \"<name>\".description: SOLVE IND "<name>": Solve for an unknown variable. Parameter: variable name (indirect allowed).

STO <number>.description: STO <number>: Store a copy of x into a destination register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STOFLAG.description: STOFLAG: estores the state of all flags that were retrieved using a previous RCLFLAG

STO IND <number>.description: STO IND <number>: Store a copy of x into a destination register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO ST <stack>.description: STO ST <stack>: Store a copy of x into a destination register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO IND ST <stack>.description: STO IND ST <stack>: Store a copy of x into a destination register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO \"<name>\".description: STO "<name>": Store a copy of x into a destination register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO IND \"<name>\".description: STO IND "<name>": Store a copy of x into a destination register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO+ <number>.description: STO+ <number>: Store addition. Adds x to an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO+ IND <number>.description: STO+ IND <number>: Store addition. Adds x to an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO+ ST <stack>.description: STO+ ST <stack>: Store addition. Adds x to an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO+ IND ST <stack>.description: STO+ IND ST <stack>: Store addition. Adds x to an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO+ \"<name>\".description: STO+ "<name>": Store addition. Adds x to an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO+ IND \"<name>\".description: STO+ IND "<name>": Store addition. Adds x to an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO- <number>.description: STO- <number>: Store subtraction. Subtracts x from an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO- IND <number>.description: STO- IND <number>: Store subtraction. Subtracts x from an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO- ST <stack>.description: STO- ST <stack>: Store subtraction. Subtracts x from an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO- IND ST <stack>.description: STO- IND ST <stack>: Store subtraction. Subtracts x from an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO- \"<name>\".description: STO- "<name>": Store subtraction. Subtracts x from an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO- IND \"<name>\".description: STO- IND "<name>": Store subtraction. Subtracts x from an existing register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO× <number>.description: STO× <number>: Store multiplication. Multiplies an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO× IND <number>.description: STO× IND <number>: Store multiplication. Multiplies an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO× ST <stack>.description: STO× ST <stack>: Store multiplication. Multiplies an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO× IND ST <stack>.description: STO× IND ST <stack>: Store multiplication. Multiplies an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO× \"<name>\".description: STO× "<name>": Store multiplication. Multiplies an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO× IND \"<name>\".description: STO× IND "<name>": Store multiplication. Multiplies an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO÷ <number>.description: STO÷ <number>: Store division. Divides an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO÷ IND <number>.description: STO÷ IND <number>: Store division. Divides an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO÷ ST <stack>.description: STO÷ ST <stack>: Store division. Divides an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO÷ IND ST <stack>.description: STO÷ IND ST <stack>: Store division. Divides an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO÷ \"<name>\".description: STO÷ "<name>": Store division. Divides an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STO÷ IND \"<name>\".description: STO÷ IND "<name>": Store division. Divides an existing register or variable by x. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

STOEL.description: STOEL: Store element. Stores a copy of x into the current element of the indexed matrix.

STOIJ.description: STOIJ: Moves the row- and column-pointers to I = x and J = y in the indexed matrix.

STOP.description: STOP: Stop program execution. (R/S in program entry mode).

STR?.description: STR?: If the x-register contains an alpha string, execute the next program line; if the x-register does not contain an alpha string, skip the next program line.

SUM.description: SUM: Returns the sums Σx and Σy into the x- and y-registers.

TIME.description: TIME: (FREE42, HP-41 Time Module Emulation) Returns the current time in the X register. The time is returned in HH.MMSSss format, with HH from 0 to 23, regardless of the CLK12/CLK24 setting. In addition, when executed from the keyboard, it displays the time in "HH:MM:SS AM" or "HH:MM:SS" format, when the display format is CLK12 or CLK24, respectively.

TONE <number>.description: TONE <number>: Sounds a tone. Parameter: tone number (0–9) (indirect allowed).

TONE IND <number>.description: TONE IND <number>: Sounds a tone. Parameter: tone number (0–9) (indirect allowed).

TONE IND ST <stack>.description: TONE IND ST <stack>: Sounds a tone. Parameter: tone number (0–9) (indirect allowed).

TONE IND \"<name>\".description: TONE IND "<name>": Sounds a tone. Parameter: tone number (0–9) (indirect allowed).

TRACE.description: TRACE: Select trace printing mode, which prints a record of keystrokes and results.

TRANS.description: TRANS: Return the transpose of the matrix in the x-register.

UVEC.description: UVEC: Unit vector. Return the unit vector for the matrix or complex number in the x-register.

VARMENU IND <number>.description: VARMENU IND <number>: Create a variable menu using MVAR instructions following the specified global label. Parameter: global program label (indirect allowed).

VARMENU IND ST <stack>.description: VARMENU IND ST <stack>: Create a variable menu using MVAR instructions following the specified global label. Parameter: global program label (indirect allowed).

VARMENU \"<name>\".description: VARMENU "<name>": Create a variable menu using MVAR instructions following the specified global label. Parameter: global program label (indirect allowed).

VARMENU IND \"<name>\".description: VARMENU IND "<name>": Create a variable menu using MVAR instructions following the specified global label. Parameter: global program label (indirect allowed).

VIEW <number>.description: VIEW <number>: View the contents of a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

VIEW IND <number>.description: VIEW IND <number>: View the contents of a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

VIEW ST <stack>.description: VIEW ST <stack>: View the contents of a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

VIEW IND ST <stack>.description: VIEW IND ST <stack>: View the contents of a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

VIEW \"<name>\".description: VIEW "<name>": View the contents of a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

VIEW IND \"<name>\".description: VIEW IND "<name>": View the contents of a register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

WMEAN.description: WMEAN: Weighted mean. Return the mean of x-values weighted by the y-values  Σxy / Σ y.

WRAP.description: WRAP: Select wrap mode, which prevents the indexed matrix from growing.

WSIZE.description: WSIZE: Sets the word size to the number in the X register, which must be between 1 and 64.

WSIZE?.description: WSIZE?: Returns the current word size.

X<> <number>.description: X<> <number>: Swaps the contents of the x-register with another register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

X<> IND <number>.description: X<> IND <number>: Swaps the contents of the x-register with another register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

X<> ST <stack>.description: X<> ST <stack>: Swaps the contents of the x-register with another register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

X<> IND ST <stack>.description: X<> IND ST <stack>: Swaps the contents of the x-register with another register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

X<> \"<name>\".description: X<> "<name>": Swaps the contents of the x-register with another register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

X<> IND \"<name>\".description: X<> IND "<name>": Swaps the contents of the x-register with another register or variable. Parameter: register or variable (indirect allowed).

X<>F.description: X<>F: Exchanges flags 0-7 with the X register. The flags are encoded as a binary integer between 0 and 255, with the least significant bits corresponding to the lowest-numbered flags.

X<>Y.description: X<>Y: Swaps the contents of the x- and y-registers.

X<0?.description: X<0?: X less than zero test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X<Y?.description: X<Y?: X less than y test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X≤0?.description: X≤0?: X less than or equal to zero test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X≤Y?.description: X≤Y?: X less than or equal to y test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X=0?.description: X=0?: X equal to zero test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X=Y?.description: X=Y?: X equal to y test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X≠0?.description: X≠0?: X not equal to zero test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X≠Y?.description: X≠Y?: X not equal to y test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X>0?.description: X>0?: X greater than zero test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X>Y?.description: X>Y?: X greater than y test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X≥0?.description: X≥0?: X greater than or equal to zero test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

X≥Y?.description: X≥Y?: X greater than or equal to y test. If true, execute the next program line; if false, skip the next program line.

XEQ <number>.description: XEQ <number>: Execute a function or program. Parameter: function or label (indirect allowed).

XEQ IND <number>.description: XEQ IND <number>: Execute a function or program. Parameter: function or label (indirect allowed).

XEQ <alpha_local_label>.description: XEQ <alpha_local_label>: Execute a function or program. Parameter: function or label (indirect allowed).

XEQ IND ST <stack>.description: XEQ IND ST <stack>: Execute a function or program. Parameter: function or label (indirect allowed).

XEQ \"<name>\".description: XEQ "<name>": Execute a function or program. Parameter: function or label (indirect allowed).

XEQ IND \"<name>\".description: XEQ IND "<name>": Execute a function or program. Parameter: function or label (indirect allowed).

XOR.description: XOR: Logical XOR (exclusive OR). Returns x XOR y.

XTOA.description: XTOA: X to alpha. Appends a character (specified by the code in the x-register) to the alpha register. If the x-register contains an alpha string, appends the entire string.

YINT.description: YINT: y-intercept. Returns the y-intercept of the curve fitted to the current statistical data.

YMD.description: YMD: Display, return, and accept dates in year/month/day format.

±.description: ±: Change the sign of the number in the x-register. While entering an exponent, can also be used to change the sign of the exponent.

Σ+.description: Σ+: Summation plus. Accumulate a pair of x- and y values into the summation registers.

Σ-.description: Σ-: Summation minus. Subtract a pair of x- and y-values from the summation registers.

ΣREG <number>.description: ΣREG <number>: Summation registers. Defines which storage register begins the block of summation registers. Parameter: register number (indirect allowed).

ΣREG IND <number>.description: ΣREG IND <number>: Summation registers. Defines which storage register begins the block of summation registers. Parameter: register number (indirect allowed).

ΣREG IND ST <stack>.description: ΣREG IND ST <stack>: Summation registers. Defines which storage register begins the block of summation registers. Parameter: register number (indirect allowed).

ΣREG IND \"<name>\".description: ΣREG IND "<name>": Summation registers. Defines which storage register begins the block of summation registers. Parameter: register number (indirect allowed).

ΣREG?.description: ΣREG?: Return the register number of the first summation register.

→DEC.description: →DEC: To decimal. Converts the octal (base 8) representation of a number to decimal (base 10). Note: This function is included to provide program compatibility with the HP-41 (which uses the function name DEC).

→DEG.description: →DEG: To degrees. Convert an angle-value from radians to degrees. Returns x×(180/π).

→HMS.description: →HMS: To hours, minutes, and seconds. Convert x from a decimal fraction to a minutes-seconds format.

→HR.description: →HR: To hours. Converts x from a minutes-seconds format to a decimal fraction.

→OCT.description: →OCT: To octal. Converts a decimal number to the octal representation. Note: This function is included to provide program compatibility with the HP-41 (which uses the function name OCT).

→POL.description: →POL: To polar. Converts x and y to the corresponding polar coordinates r and θ. If the x-register contains a complex number, converts the two parts of the number to polar values.

→RAD.description: →RAD: To radians. Converts a angle value in degrees to radians. Returns x×(π/180).

→REC.description: →REC: To rectangular. Converts r (in the x-register) and θ (in the y-register) to the corresponding rectangular coordinates, x and y. If the X-register contains a complex number, converts the two parts of the number to rectangular values.

←.description: ←: Move left one element in the indexed matrix.

↑.description: ↑: Move up one element in the indexed matrix.

↓.description: ↓: Move down one element in the indexed matrix.

→.description: →: Move right one element in the indexed matrix.

%.description: %: Percent. Returns (x × y) / 100. Leaves the y value in the y-register.⊢

LOOP control number [ccccccc.fffii].description: Loop initial value [ccccccc.fffii]: ccccccc is the current counter value, fff is the counter test value, ii is the increment/decrement value.

LOOP with ISG template.description: Loop ISG: Increment, skip if greater ! Sets and stores initial value, creates a label, creates a placeholder for the loop code and inserts the ISG loop check at the end.

LOOP with DSE template.description: Loop DSE: Decrement, skip if less than or equal ! Sets and stores initial value, creates a label, creates a placeholder for the loop code and inserts the DSE loop check at the end.

LOOP with condition template.description: Loop with condition: Creates a label, creates a placeholder for the loop code and inserts the condition at the end.

LBL program template.description: LBL program template: Creates a header line, a label and the program end.

MENU controlled branching template.description: Menu controlled branching: A menu template.

SF 25 using error trap template.description: SF 25: A template to ignore next error.

PROMPT using two-line display template.description: PROMPT using two-line display: A template for two-line display. '␊' is for the line feed.

VARMENU using menu variables template.description: PROMPT using two-line display: A template for two-line display. '␊' is for the line feed.

body: // Express the eqution, such that its right side equals 0.
SOLVE template.description: SOLVE template: A template for the solver. Equation must equal to 0. Refer to 'HP-42S Programming Examples' page 78.

INTEG template.description: INTEG template: A template for the integration application. Refer to 'HP-42S Programming Examples' page 126.
